meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a pharaoh or the ancient Egyptian civilization.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a pharaonic headdress worn by a ruler.
meanings.sent2: The pharaonic statues stood tall in the temple courtyard.
meanings.sent3: The pharaonic cat statue seemed to be guarding the entrance playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her pharaonic presence commanded attention in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The pharaonic architecture of the pyramid was awe-inspiring.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the pharaohs of ancient Egypt.
meanings.sent1: The pharaonic artifacts unearthed by archaeologists revealed ancient customs.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study the pharaonic era to understand Egyptian history.
meanings.sent3: The pharaonic crown was accidentally placed on the wrong statue.
meanings.sent4: His leadership style was often described as pharaonic by his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The pharaonic tombs held secrets waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of the pharaohs in power or magnificence.
meanings.sent1: The pharaonic procession through the city was a grand spectacle.
meanings.sent2: The pharaonic palace gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing its opulence.
meanings.sent3: The pharaonic feast was fit for royalty, with lavish dishes and decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her pharaonic charisma drew people to her effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The pharaonic crown sparkled with precious gems, symbolizing authority.
